Name: Lintel of Tuthmosis the First
Description: The lintel, a horizontal board or stone above a door, is decorated with the cartouche of Tuthmosis the First as well as figures of Seth and Nubti sculpted on either side of the cartouche. The falcon Horus is standing above the Serekh, or palace facade, on which is inscribed the Horus name of the King, Ka-nakht-mery-Maat, which means the "strong bull," and "the one who loves justice."
